ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I think about the possibility of good things not happening in the future.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always

ElementDescription: I spend time thinking about bad things that could happen.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always

ElementDescription: When something bad happens, I can't stop myself from thinking about whether it will happen again.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always

ElementDescription: I think about how to accomplish my future goals.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always

ElementDescription: When I don't get something that I want, I think about whether I will ever get the things that I want in life.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always

ElementDescription: When I am looking forward to something, I can't stop myself from thinking about what it will be like.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always

ElementDescription: I imagine the steps I need to take to get things that I want in life.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always

ElementDescription: I think about the worst possible things that could happen.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always

ElementDescription: When I picture good things happening in my future, it is as if they are actually happening to me now.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always

ElementDescription: I daydream about the things that I want happening to me in the future.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always

ElementDescription: I make specific plans for how to get things that I want in life.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always

ElementDescription: I think about the possibility of losing people of things that are important to me.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always

ElementDescription: When I think about something bad happening, I have a hard time thinking about anything else.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always

ElementDescription: I play out scenes in my head over and over again about bad things that could happen.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always

ElementDescription: When I picture something good happening to me, I get so caught up in the moment that I don't pay attention to other things.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always

ElementDescription: I think about the ways in which my life will be good in the future.
Notes: 1 = Almost never; 2 = Sometimes; 3 = Often; 4 = Almost always
